About Contributing | About Connecting

About Finding & Collecting


Tutorial: Search & Browse
Finding Resources on Curriki

Photo Credit: Lloyd Gallman

  • Access top-rated curricula in core subjects.

    {pre}
    » Math » English Language Arts
    » Science » Social Studies
    {/pre}

  • Search Currikis growing repository.

    » Try an Advanced Search

  • Locate resources in any subject area.

    » Browse Resources



How to Collect Resources

#if($context.user=="XWiki.XWikiGuest") Login or become a member to collect resources on Curriki. #else Go to: My Favorites |  My Collections

#end

Search & Bookmark Using
Your Favorites

Collecting this way is quick and easy.

Step 1

Search for resources


Step 2

For any resource you want to remember, click the "Favorite" link


Step 3

Find the resource again in My Curriki


 » Start Searching

Organize & Present Resources
in a Collection

Collecting this way lets you organize resources by topic according to your needs

Step 1

Add a collection enter a name, description, and information tags


Step 2

Build and organize that collection in the Currikulum Builder; or


Step 3

Access your new collection in My Curriki and add from there


#if($context.user=="XWiki.XWikiGuest") » Add a Collection #else  » Add a Collection #end

 » View a Sample Collection

Tips on Finding & Collecting Resources
  • Found a really great resource?
    Click Nominate to get it rated by the Curriki Review System.

  • Interested in finding materials contributed by Currikis partners?
    Look for the P icon in search results

  • Want to collect useful resources for your group?
    Start at a groups Curriculum tab and click Add a Group Collection.
